title: The Body
content: What are some popular fonts for body copy these days?
author: snackz

comments.content:
Maybe you like Anziano, Delicato and Tarocco? Have a look for yourself at:

[http://www.macrhino.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20070302153822/http:/www.macrhino.com/)

](http://web.archive.org/web/20070302153822/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=GF.118888.0.0) [Freight Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20070302153822/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=GF.118890.0.0)

There are honestly too many to list. What are your needs?
You want popular or underused? Stefan and Tiff listed some critically acclaimed stuff that is not very common and I think that’s a good goal to shoot for. Let us know and I’ll list some more.
I’m looking for a body font for a hockey magazine…

I am interested in well known fonts as well.  
GIllSans light is being used currently. I don’t think it works for the publication.
Gill Sans light? At what point size is it being used? I’d think the hockey audience would want something with thicker legs.

A slab or something with sharp-serifs like the skates?
